content.webTitle: If you liked the sound of that ... try these

fields.headline: If you liked the sound of that ... try these
fields.bodyText: South Africa Southern right whales flock to South Africa's Western Cape to breed, coming right in to the shore. The best time to see them is August when a six-day trip to Hermanus costs from £975 per person with Rainbow Tours (020 7226 1004; rainbowtours.co.uk). The price includes flights, B&B and hire car. Two-hour boat trips cost from £32. Mexico Every winter, grey whales migrate from Alaska to the warm waters of Baja California, Mexico, to breed. Journey Latin America (020 8747 8315; journeylatinamerica.co.uk) offers a 10-night Baja trip starting at £1,414 per person, taking in two days' whale watching and six days' kayaking in the Sea of Cortez. The price includes flights, transfers, accommodation with most meals, guides and equipment. Departures 3 and 24 February. Azores The oceans around the Azores are marvellous for spotting whales of every kind. Sunvil Discovery (020 8758 4722; sunvil.co.uk) runs a whale and dolphin-watching trip between 5 April and 19 October from £668 per person. The price includes direct flights, transfers, seven nights' B&B accommodation on Sao Miguel and five whale and dolphin-watching outings.
